fields.name: jobs
fields.description: Jobs list, it will be empty if there is none

fields.name: version
fields.description: Query schema version

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Viewer of the query

types.name: JobsConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

types.name: Job
types.description: Job managed by a ProActive Scheduler instance. A Job is made of one or more Tasks.

fields.name: dataManagement
fields.description: User configuration for data spaces.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the job.

fields.name: finishedTime
fields.description: The timestamp at which the Job has finished its execution.

fields.name: genericInformation
fields.description: Generic information list, empty if there is none.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the Job.

fields.name: inErrorTime
fields.description: A timestamp that depicts the time at which the Job was marked in-error for the last time.

fields.name: maxNumberOfExecution
fields.description: The maximum number of execution attempts for the Tasks associated to this Job. The value may be redefined at the Task level.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Job's name.

fields.name: numberOfFailedTasks
fields.description: Number of failed Tasks contained in the Job.

fields.name: numberOfFaultyTasks
fields.description: Number of faulty Tasks contained in Job.

fields.name: numberOfFinishedTasks
fields.description: Number of finished Tasks contained in Job.

fields.name: numberOfInErrorTasks
fields.description: Number of in-error Tasks contained in the Job.

fields.name: numberOfPendingTasks
fields.description: Number of pending Tasks contained in the Job.

fields.name: numberOfRunningTasks
fields.description: Number of running Tasks contained in the Job.

fields.name: onTaskError
fields.description: The behaviour applied on Tasks when an error occurs.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: Job's owner.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: Job priority.

fields.name: projectName
fields.description: Project name which the job belongs to.

fields.name: removedTime
fields.description: Job removed time.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Start time.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Scheduling status of a job.

fields.name: submittedTime
fields.description: Job submitted time.

fields.name: tasks
fields.description: Task list of the job, empty if there is none.

fields.name: totalNumberOfTasks
fields.description: Total number of Tasks of the Job.

fields.name: variables
fields.description: Variable list, empty if there is none.

types.name: DataManagement
types.description: Represents a Job configuration for managing data. It contains user defined data space URLs. Data spaces are used to fetch and push files between the Scheduler and Tasks. A data space URL set to `null` means that the space started with the Scheduler instance is used.

fields.name: globalSpaceUrl
fields.description: The URL of the global space that is shared between all ProActive users.

fields.name: inputSpaceUrl
fields.description: The URL of a read-only space that is personal to the ProActive user running the Job.

fields.name: outputSpaceUrl
fields.description: The URL of a private space that is personal to the ProActive user running the Job and used to push results.

fields.name: userSpaceUrl
fields.description: The URL of the user space that is personal to the ProActive user running the Job.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key as the key in a map

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value as the value in a map

types.name: KeyValue
types.description: Key value type as a map

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key as the key in a map

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value as the value in a map

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: Key as the key value of a map

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Value as the value of a map

types.name: OnTaskError
types.description: Defines the behaviour that is applied on Tasks when an error occurs.

enumValues.name: CANCEL_JOB
enumValues.description: Cancel job after all execution attempts

enumValues.name: CONTINUE_JOB_EXECUTION
enumValues.description: Continue job execution (try all execution attempts)

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: None

enumValues.name: PAUSE_JOB
enumValues.description: Suspend task after first and pause job

enumValues.name: PAUSE_TASK
enumValues.description: Suspend task after first error and continue others

enumValues.name: HIGH
enumValues.description: High priority

enumValues.name: HIGHEST
enumValues.description: Highest priority

enumValues.name: IDLE
enumValues.description: Idle

enumValues.name: LOW
enumValues.description: Low priority

enumValues.name: LOWEST
enumValues.description: Lowest priority

enumValues.name: NORMAL
enumValues.description: Normal priority

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The job has been canceled due to user exception and order. This status runs when a user exception occurs in a task and when the user has asked to cancel On exception.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The job has failed. One or more tasks have failed (due to resources failure). There is no more executionOnFailure left for a task.

enumValues.name: FINISHED
enumValues.description: The job is finished. Every tasks are finished.

enumValues.name: IN_ERROR
enumValues.description: The job has at least one in-error task and in-error tasks are the last, among others which have changed their state (i.e. Job status is depicted by the last action).

enumValues.name: KILLED
enumValues.description: The job has been killed by a user. Nothing can be done anymore on this job except reading execution information such as output, time, etc.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: The job is paused waiting for user to resume it.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The job is waiting to be scheduled.

enumValues.name: RUNNING
enumValues.description: The job is running. Actually at least one of its task has been scheduled.

enumValues.name: STALLED
enumValues.description: The job has been launched but no task are currently running

types.name: TasksConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

types.name: Task
types.description: Task managed by a ProActive Scheduler instance. A task is a unit of work that is executed on a ProActive node.

fields.name: additionalClasspath
fields.description: The list of "pathElement" representing the classpath to be added when starting the new JVM.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A sentence that describes the purpose of the Task.

fields.name: executionDuration
fields.description: Execution duration of the Task in milliseconds.

fields.name: executionHostName
fields.description: Execution host name on which the Task is running.

fields.name: finishedTime
fields.description: The time at which the Task has finished (timestamp).

fields.name: genericInformation
fields.description: Generic information list, empty if there is none.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the Task for a given Job.

fields.name: inErrorTime
fields.description: The timestamp that depicts the time at which the Task was maked in-error for the last time.

fields.name: javaHome
fields.description: Java installation directory on the node side.

fields.name: jobId
fields.description: The identifier the Job which the Task belongs to.

fields.name: jvmArguments
fields.description: JVM arguments

fields.name: maxNumberOfExecution
fields.description: The maximum number of execution attempts for the Task.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the Task. Please note that Task names are unique per Job.

fields.name: numberOfExecutionLeft
fields.description: Number of execution left.

fields.name: numberOfExecutionOnFailureLeft
fields.description: Number of execution on failure left.

fields.name: onTaskError
fields.description: The behaviour applied on Tasks when an error occurs.

fields.name: preciousLogs
fields.description: If the value is `true`, then it means that full task logs are kept.

fields.name: preciousResult
fields.description: If the value is `true`, then it means the result of the Task is saved in the Job result.

fields.name: runAsMe
fields.description: If `true`, if means that the Task script or command is executed with the system account associated to the current Job owner value.

fields.name: scheduledTime
fields.description: Scheduled time for running the task.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Start time.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Task status.

fields.name: tag
fields.description: Task tag.

fields.name: variables
fields.description: Variable list, empty if there is none.

fields.name: walltime
fields.description: Maximum execution time allowed for the Task (in milliseconds).

fields.name: workingDir
fields.description: Working folder of the Task that is executed on a ProActive node.

types.name: RestartMode
types.description: The restart mode configured for the Task if an error occurs during its execution.

enumValues.name: ANYWHERE
enumValues.description: The task is restarted on any available node (possibly the same as the one where the error occurred).

enumValues.name: ELSEWHERE
enumValues.description: The task is restarted on a node that is different from the node where the error occurred.

enumValues.name: ABORTED
enumValues.description: The task has been aborted by an exception on an other task while the task is running (job has cancelOnError=true). Can be also in this status if the job is killed while the concerned task was running.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The task is failed (only if max execution time has been reached and the node on which it was started is down).

enumValues.name: FAULTY
enumValues.description: The task has finished execution with error code (!=0) or exception.

enumValues.name: FINISHED
enumValues.description: The task has finished execution.

enumValues.name: IN_ERROR
enumValues.description: The task is suspended after first error and is waiting for a manual restart action.

enumValues.name: NOT_RESTARTED
enumValues.description: The task could not be restarted. It means that the task could not be restarted after an error during the previous execution.

enumValues.name: NOT_STARTED
enumValues.description: The task could not be started. It means that the task could not be started due to one ore more dependency failure.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: The task is paused

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The task is in the scheduler pending queue.

enumValues.name: RUNNING
enumValues.description: The task is executing.

enumValues.name: SKIPPED
enumValues.description: The task was not executed: it was the non-selected branch of an IF/ELSE control flow action.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: The task has just been submitted by the user.

enumValues.name: WAITING_ON_ERROR
enumValues.description: The task is waiting for restart after an error (i.e. native code != 0 or exception).

enumValues.name: WAITING_ON_FAILURE
enumValues.description: The task is waiting for restart after a failure (i.e. node down).

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

inputFields.name: projectName
inputFields.description: Project name which the job belongs to

fields.name: login
fields.description: Login name of the viewer

fields.name: sessionId
fields.description: Session ID of the viewer

fields.name: jobs
fields.description: Jobs list, it will be empty if there is none

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.
